sub_title: Lecturer in Chemistry at Avans Hogeschool
summary:
“And the only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle. As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you find it”
Steve Jobs (Stanford commencement address; June 12, 2005)


Since I started my study in chemistry in 1981, I am particularly intrigued by its fundamental aspects. In that perspective, a specialization in physical chemistry was a logical choice. Chemical accounting, aquatic chemistry and particularly chemical thermodynamics and phase theory have my special interest.
The most inspiring and challenging part of what I do as a lecturer, is to show the students the beauty of these (logical but sometimes difficult) domains and to encourage them to look on to it. The biggest reward being the moment when the penny drops. 

In addition to teaching, I like to work on improving the environment in which students can work on their future. This I mainly do as member of the board of examiners. For me the personal approach is always the starting point.


“It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge”
Albert Einstein
